maml:description.maml:para: Add an entry to the tickle database.

Add a tickle event to the database. The command will use the Tickle variables for, although you can override the server instance parameter. It is strongly recommended that you avoid using special characters, especially apostrophes, in your event name.

maml:Description.maml:para: Enter the name of the event.
Enter the datetime for the event
Enter an option comment or description.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Write the new event object to the pipeline.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Enter an option comment or description.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Enter the datetime for the event
Enter the name of the event.
Write the new event object to the pipeline.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add an event to the database.

maml:description.maml:para: Export a tickle database to a cliXML file
Use this command to export the entire tickle database to an XML file. This can be in addition to whatever SQL Server backup procedures you may follow. The xml file is created with Export-CliXML.

maml:Description.maml:para: The path and filename for the export xml file.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The path and filename for the export xml file.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Export the database to a Dropbox folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Get one or more tickle event entries.
This command will query the tickle event database and return matching events. The parameters are used to fine-tune the query and should be self-explanatory.
The default behavior is to query the designated SQL Server instance, but you can specify a CSV file of event log entries and access the event data in an offline, or read-only mode.

maml:Description.maml:para: List all entries in the tickle event database table.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
List entries that have been marked as Archived.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Get events in the next number of days.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Display an event by its ID number.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Display an event by its name.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Display events that have expired.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Access an offline, CSV version. It is assumed you have previously run a command like Get-TickleEvent | Export-CSV tickleexport.csv

dev:remarks.maml:para: Display all non-expired and non-archived events.
Display all non-expired and non-archived events scheduled for the next 14 days.
Display all non-expired and non-archived events scheduled for the next 14 days.

maml:description.maml:para: Import event data from a cliXML file
If you export a tickle database with the Export-TickleDatabase command, you can re-import it into a new or different SQL Srrver instance with this command.

maml:Description.maml:para: The path and filename for the export xml file.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialize a new tickle event database

Use this command to initialize a new tickle event database and table. You need to specify the path for the new database file. The command will use the built in Tickle variables so update them if necessary prior to running this command.

maml:Description.maml:para: The folder for the database to be created.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

The folder for the database to be created.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Initialize and empty database and create the files at c:\db\mytickle. The folder must exist before running this command.

maml:description.maml:para: Delete a tickle event from the database.
Events in the tickle database remain, even though they may not be displayed by default. Normally you can archive expired events. But you can also delete entries with this command.

maml:Description.maml:para: A tickle event ID.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable

Remove all events with a name of Dentist. Note that this will only remove un-expired and un-archived entries.

maml:description.maml:para: Use this command to update or modify an existing tickle event. This command will use the Tickle variables for its defaults.

maml:Description.maml:para: Select an event by its ID.
Mark an entry as archived. The current version of the module retains all events in a single database table.

Get all expired events and mark them as archived.

maml:description.maml:para: Display a colorized list of upcoming events.

This is a specialized version of Get-TickleEvent that uses Write-Host to display a formatted and colorized display of upcoming events. Events due in 24 hours or less will be displayed in red. Events due in 48 hours or less will be displayed in yellow. Otherwise the event is displayed in green. It is not possible to modify these colors at this time. The default behavior is to show events due in the next number of days as specified by $TickleDefaultDays.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Specify the next number of days to display.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.
Specify the next number of days to display.
Use an offline version of the tickle event database. Specify the path to the CSV file.
Specify a credential to authenticate to the SQL Server instance. This should normally not be required.
Specify the next number of days to display.
Use an offline version of the tickle event database. Specify the path to the CSV file.
The name of your SQL Server instance. The parameter will default to the module variable.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The actual output would be colorized.
